content.description:
Easy slab

(First Ascent app calls this "Anchor 1 center left")
content.protection: Top rope bolt anchors without rap rings
content.location: This is the south-most top-rope anchor, climbing straight up, on the right side of the big divot/pothole.

content.description:
Mostly easy slab, but after you walk(!) across the flat part of the big pothole, there are a few steeper, more challenging moves.

(First Ascent app calls this "Anchor 2 center", 5.10a.)
content.protection: Top rope bolt anchors without rap rings
content.location: This is at the south top-rope anchors, using the middle of the 3 anchors, and climbing straight up through the middle of the big divot/pothole.

content.description: Climb the overhanging hand crack out of the small cave.
content.protection:
On lead: rack of singles to 3.5", if desiring a big first piece; otherwise 1.5" and smaller rest of way up. Note the expansion behind the lip at many spots of this irregular jagged crack.

Anchor bolts with only hangers just above the lip, with no rap rings/chains.

Natural anchor available at topout ledge above. Walk off to climber's right and toward backside, to circle clockwise down back to base.
content.location:
This is located in a small cave on the upper west side of Pothole Dome.

Park in the paved turnout across from Marmot Dome. Hike around the west (left) side of Pothole Dome for about 0.25 miles.

content.description: Same start as Pick Your Poison Center but with a slight variation. Instead of going directly over the center bulge move to the right and climb over the large flake and then veer back left towards the anchor.

About 15 feet to the left/west of the anchor is a black water streak. The route follows it 3/4 of the way up and then veers back right toward the anchors. The crux is only 1 or 2 moves into the real climbing (not the class 3-4 slab in the begining).
content.location: The anchor to the right of the Christmas Tree anchor, second from the north end of the face, located roughly 500 yards north of the parking lot. Easiest way to find the beginning of this route is to find the top anchors. You can walk off further to the west where the slab is more gradual or rappel.

content.description: This climb ascends a direct line straight up and over the bulge in the center (towards your anchor). The bulge is the crux with some decently thin moves.
content.location: Same top-rope anchor as Pick Your Poison Left. Follow your rope straight up. A little left of a large flake.

content.description:
Start at the shrub and cracks and go straight up to the anchor, to the right of the mound

(First Ascent app calls this "Anchor 3 center left")
content.protection: Top rope bolt anchors without rap rings
content.location: This is the left-most of the 3 south top-rope anchors, on the left side of the big divot/pothole.

content.description:
LOCATION:

The northern most top-rope anchor (fixed bolt hangers). Roughly 500 yards from the parking lot is a series of anchor setups that ascend medium angled slab. This route is accessed via the furthest one to the north.

CLIMBS: 5.6 the hardest section, is directly below the anchor and slightly right of the black streak. Some 5-15 feet left of the black streak is some slab climbing that ranges from 5.1-5.4 and curves back right toward the anchor. 10 feet to the right of your anchor/rope is a route that climbs an obvious flake and veers back left toward the top.

PRO:Bolt hanger anchors-possibly some trad on the large flake.

APPROACH: Plenty of ways to the top but most, if not all, ascend class 3 slab. Most of the anchors are a little ways from the edge but the rope drag isn't...terrible.
